TAKE him he is the best so much extra credit and talk to him he likes you more, go to class most of the time, but GO TO OFFICE HOURS!!! you get help and the hw! ***Also DO NOT buy the book you don't need it, if you want to get an A in this class get help from him, office hours, , READ his slides and make friends trust me
It's a comp sci class so obviously it won't be easy. But he's your best bet to get an A. He really cares and will help you as long as you're respectful and actually care too.

Best Comp apps teacher at rutgers. Truly a nice guy who cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Recitation is mandatory attendance but lectures aren't.    His slides are vague so be sure to pay attention to what hes saying about them in lecture. Used the textbook to supplement what I learned, not to teach myself. Do the HW!
good dude. do extra credit

LOVE HIM!!!!!! He has AMAZING Slides, I saw the slides for other professors for CS 170 and they were nothing compared to Geraci's! He offers alot of help outside the classroom and extended review sessions, and he answers questions through email and during his office hours! He gave alot of extra credits which bumped my grade up! MUST TAKE
Fernando was one the best professors I've had so far here. His lectures are amazing and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. He is a must take!

The best professor to take for comp apps he's great and cares about his students. Classes aren't boring, he jokes around and if you participate he'll respect you he likes to get to know his students. Extra credit opportunities, there to help you when you need it, and he's cute (super charming accent).
Amazing professor. TAKE HIM FOR COMP APPS! A lot of extra credit opportunities and really helps out his students. He really goes out of his way to help out.
Really cares about his students. Easily the best professor to take for Computer Applications for Business at Rutgers. All around good dude.

He is one of the best professors that I have taken at Rutgers. He really goes out of his way to make sure his students do great. Take him, and you will not be disappointed, he really tries and does his best. Also he's a really great person that loves to joke around.

you have assignments due every week. of all of the comp apps teachers, he is def the best. he has a busy schedule, but always replies to emails or questions you have. he really cares about his students.
Super helpful, sweet, and passionate about the subject.  Just make sure not to fall behind, or class can become hard.

To put it into perspective. People in other sections of this course came to hear Prof. Geraci's lectures. Of all the options he is the best. He is friendly and fair. The course isn't an easy "A", but that's because they keep changing things, and he does what he can to help students out. You need the textbook, but reading before class is optional.

If you have never taken a cs 111 class, I wouldn't recommend this professor. He talks a bit fast and assumes that you know what he is taking about. The one good thing is  he makes an effort to see you during office hours if you need any help.

Having no prior knowledge of CS, I struggled in Thu's class. A lot of kids go to other profs because every cs111 teaches the same thing and they think the other profs are better.  Thu is very knowledge and willing to answer questions even though no one ever really does

He is an overall good professor. BUT, if you don't have a background( even a little bit) in CS he may be more difficult than expected. He goes DEEP into the why of Computer Science and the logic of code, interesting to learn (and useful later in CS), but unnecessary for 111.  Office Hours are very helpful, and he genuinely cares about students.
Speaks way too fast, especially in a beginner level course. Not recommended for 111.

Thu is really a great professor in OS field. He's class is passionate. If you are interested in OS and eager to learn more about OS, CS519 is suitable for you. But if you are not so interested in OS or have a weak background in OS, you won't catch up with him in class. And the programming assignment is a little bit difficult.

A pretty good teacher overall. His assignments and exams are very challenging. In the end there was a generous curve. He will push you hard to do the work. Don't expect to slack off at all. However its good that he pushes you since you will learn the subject well in the end. Very helpful in office hours too.

He speaks pretty fast but he's always very clear on what he said. CS211 isn't as bad as people say if you take it with him. Do the work! If you do that you're fine. Probably went to 10 lectures throughout the whole semester and ended up with a B+.
Pass this guy up if you can or otherwise make sure your life is os for the entire semester.

How can Thu get a bad rating? This is one of the best CS professors there is. Yes he pushes the students hard, he explains this day one. His projects are HARD but exams are fair and he is a great lecturer and very helpful. This is what a 400 level course should be. And if you have the time to stick with it, you will come out really understanding OS

Good teacher, but CompArch is not his field. If you have research interests in CompArch, then take the course with a prof who knows the subject better. OTOH if you are taking it as a refresher course, go ahead.. but he does tend to make the course entail a lot of work.. Exams are open book and easy!

Great professor, only worth while one in entire department.  Take him.  He is challenging and will have you coding parts of the Linux Kernel, but it is great and it will be the only CS class you take where you learn anything at all.  Better than all the rest

Great class to take IF you want a challenge. The exams are very straight-forward if you understand the material (open note/book exams!). Thu is very helpful in and out of lecture. Projs are really cool but long. Take this class only if you have ample free time to work! Not an easy A but VERY doable.
Not recommended. Very tough projects, extremely tough exams. Please take other professor if you have a choice.

projects are hard and long but you do learn a lot in the end. take if you don't want to be bored in class and are willing to ignore your other classes.  if you take the class find someone smart to team up with.

his projects are insane. take these warnings serious. some of our projects we get can be found in 500 level courses. the other sections don't have as harse a time as we do in his class. for the love of all that is holy, don't take his section.
take his class if youre willing to hire outsourced workers to do the projects for you
his projects are ridiculous...assigns grad level projects to undergrad....not fair
hes an insane maniac

Abdul Basit is a passionate and knowledgable lecturer.  There is no end to his availability. If you need help you get it no question. All his homework is written by himself and handed out so you won't need the book.   I highly recommend him!! He is super smart and knows the material...

Not a great lecturer or good at explaining concepts so you can't really rely on lecture to learn the concepts. In place of a textbook you are given packets containing chapters from a number of books and they are AWFUL. They all use different notation and don't have nearly enough examples, so you can't rely on the book to teach you either.

Funny, personable, he is one of the few professors at Rutgers who really care about their students. There is a final exam, no midterm, some homeworks, a group project, and a few quizzes along the way. The material is difficult but an A or a B in this class is definitely attainable if you do the work and go to class.

Homeworks every week. No midterm Just Final Exam and Final term project done in a group 2-3 people. Remind's me of a frat bro, cool guy, seems very intelligent. Class is rough you'll never understand the information. Grades are rarely posted until basically end of semester. Major curve. easy B if you do all the worK. B+ achievable as well.
He was my TA for CS 535 and he was awesome. I really hope he gives me good grade for the exams! Definitely recommend for the future!

Exams are pretty straight forward. The TAs were a bit harsh in grading, but fair if you clearly explain what you did(and if the answer is right). The hws are also straight forward, just require thinking.However,the professor is awesome. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS if you need help. He's willing to explain things in detail and wants you to succeed.

Lectures are bland as he just teaches right out of the book. Mid-term was hard, Some HW's were hard, but he made the final easy. He was ok, class was 4 hours long and he's pretty slow and boring. However, his TA's were strict graders for this class.
Had him as TA for 206. Best TA I've had at RU so far. No words to describe him other than amazing. You will learn A LOT and be A LOT more prepared for exams. Wish he was my TA for all of my classes!!

Took the first class he has ever taught as a professor over the summer. He's very helpful and patient. If you don't understand anything, he's willing to go over it with you. He's also very compromising with your grade and offers plenty of opportunities to make up for lost points. There must have been a huge curve since I got an A.

I'm leaving this review because I was surprised to see such a low rating. He's a fantastic teacher. Changes the difficulty of exams based on results making it very fair. Go to lectures, answer the clicker questions, stay focused, try on homework, and do the practice exams! You will do well on the exams there are no surprises which I like.

His exams are tough and lectures can get pretty boring in 206, but he actually cares for his students' success as long as students put in the effort. Extremely helpful in office hours. Encourages study groups and only assigns one hw a week. If you participate in lecture and recitation he'll consider boosting your grade (bring a B+ to an A, etc.)

1 short assignment which take about an hour or 2 to do each week, unless there's an exam coming up. Very similar to stuff covered in lecture, the slide for which are put online. Lots of iClicker questions but they're free points. and enough helpful office hours to make me think he's got nothing better to do. (especially around midtermsfinals)

At the beginning of the semester he seemed alright. After too many people did well on the first test it bothered him so he increased the difficulty of the class. This was complimented with less clear lectures as he tried to deflate people's grades.

I also had him for F13 CS206. He actually changed how he was presenting the material based on how the students were doing.  He is a nice guy, and cares that you learn the material.  I wish there we more like him in Rutgers CS.

also was in 206 for fall'13 semester. I was worried when i saw his horrible rating but i feel he has gotten a bad rap. He is a good guy and a fair grader.  I really enjoyed the clicker questions in class, fun and challenging.  This is not an easy course, you gotta put in time and effort. I highly recommend forming a study/homework group early on.

Had him for Discrete 2 during Fall 2013. Class is well organized, well taught, and the prof. and the TA both clearly invested a lot of time into the class. He is, perhaps, not the most clear during his lectures - but if you put forth even a little effort (which admittedly I didn't do) you will understand him. I say this as a mediocre math student.

Everything he showed in lecture was straight from the book, but for some reason attendance is mandatory. The material itself isn't that hard to learn, but the questions on HW and exams are weirdly worded making it hard to understand what you're supposed to do. Take his class if you're looking to bring down your gpa.

I took Discrete Structures 2 with him and he is just awful and explaining the material. The course is extremely and unnecessarily difficult. He is a very intelligent person and he is unable to explain anything. He's nice but gives you the illusion things will be easy when in fact they aren't. You kill so much time on homework. Horrible Professor.

He is a rough professor to take a probabilities course with. To his credit he makes himself available but the homework is on another level from the actual material and it takes much more time just to figure out what the question is asking for than actually doing it. Essentially you feel like a failure for a semester.

As others have stated, he teaches straight from the book, providing no insight, and then requires attendance. The homework is ridiculously engineered: he spends time preparing you to complete the chapter review questions and then assigns POORLY written & worded problems for homework. If he wanted to reinforce, he'd assign ch. review problems...

Schliep seriously needs to reconsider teaching this subject. I enjoyed taking statistics, and this class is much like it, but the professor just can't TEACH! He continously does problems from the book, but his assignments/exams are nothing like those concepts. In fact, they are awfully annoying and unclear. Please avoid him and save your life.

This professor is just miserable. Teaches theory straight out of the book with no deviation...word for word, and then has the audacity to take attendance. His homework assignments and test are a pretentious mess. His wording is way to confusing. Going to class is like going to the dentist, but a dentist that did not use anesthesia.
Horrible professor. Wouldn't take a class with him again

Seriously. Avoid this guy if you can afford to.  All he does is spoon feeds you the textbook.  I have not payed attention at all in that class because it's so boring.  I don't think I would hate the class so much if he wasn't teaching it.  Seriously.

Schliep is the worst professor I have ever taken. His lecture consists of him reading directly from the book. Attendance is mandatory. His homework is confusing and the questions are poorly worded. DO NOT TAKE 206 WITH HIM!

Took Intro to Discrete Structures with him over the summer and regretted the decision. He is terrible at explaining things and skips over material that later ends up on a test. He taught our class Aristotelian logic, which is not even a topic in discrete structures... He has a passion for what he teaches, but does a very poor job of teaching.
good

Professor Liviu is one the best professors i have dealt with. He explains each topic to the finer granularity. He wont hurry with the lecture, waits for questions and explains it till the student gets a hold. He is very lenient with the grades provided you are comfortable with the concepts. And gives a good curve.

This guy really knows his stuff. He left half way through the semester because of sickness, but I loved the way he taught this class. He set up piazza with the T.A.'s for the class to do assignments so you were never completely screwed. That being said this is a tough class, you will learn a lot but it's definitely not easy!
Quite a weird experience. I would not want to pass another exam with this person again.
Excellent professor. Truly cared about whether the class was learning the material. Highly recommended.

Iftode took an unique approach of teaching the OS course by giving the student an actual hand-on experience of reading, modifying and extending a complete Unix kernel code -- MIT's xv6. Currently he is the only Professor at Rutgers that does it. You will probably not likely to have this experience if you take any other Professor's course.

If you're really interested in Operating Systems, this is definitely the class to take - his class is hard, but you will learn A LOT. Liviu is definitely not a "bad" professor - he knows the subject well (unlike some others), and will take time to answer questions thoroughly if things are not clear. Be ready to spend your weekends writing OS code!

The man's a terrible teacher.  Very intelligent, yes, but incredibly lazy.  Do not miss an exam or you will find yourself pulling your hair out dealing with the man.  On top of that, you have to strain yoru ears to understand the words under his thick accent.  On a difficult subject like OS design, having an incomprehensible professor is no good.

He thinks he is smart, but not for the years of experience he has. And tries to show it off to students who are new to the course (field). That generally kills their interest (and not to mention their grades and the scholarship that goes with it). He should really take some elimentary lessons about how to be a good teacher.

He's really, really smart and knows basically everything about his area of research... but he expects you to know it all too. He disappears for weeks at a time after giving ridiculous assignments, asks you to read tons of papers in a day or two and then have an exam on them and generally is insane.

Tina's knowledge is profound and the resources she brings into the course are awesome. She is easily approachable and always happy to help her students. She is precise about grades, but she made it upfront about the grading policies of the course making clear on what she is expecting. Don't expect for extra credits and submit assignments on time.

Professor Tina is one the best professors i have dealt with. She takes care of her students in case of any doubts. Knows each and every students in the class. You have to be extra careful with regards to home works and projects. Please submit them on time or else this will spoil your grade. Breadth of the course is great and the slides are amazing.

Richter is an incredibly nice guy. He's helpful in office hours and gives pretty clear lectures. But to do well, you must take excellent notes because there's no textbook, and sometimes he erases things immediately after writing them, so you need to pay attention. The midterm, HW and Matlab projects weren't too hard but the final was very difficult

Probably one of the worst CS classes you can take at Rutgers. There were only three Matlab projects for the whole semester and they counted for so little of your grade. Homework takes a long time to finish and is usually based off material he barely spoke about in class. The final was brutal and nothing like what he said it would be. Do not take!
Didn't use class time very well. After explaining a new topic, he wouldn't always go over examples to help clarify the topic, and that would help on upcoming assignments and exams.

great professor: crystal clear lectures, helpful and nice. hwk/exams are not easy but grading is not not harsh. go to EVERY lecture, do all the hwk and understand them and you'll be fine. if you can do some practice questions from somewhere else it'll be a plus..

He knows the subject and can teach but he goes fast. His exams, homework, and grading are VERY HARD. Expect one full grade less then what is fair. Crib sheets are allowed. No specific book for course but notes & lectures are good. Search for class on Rutgers website before end of prior semester for homework Q&As. Not the same problems but similar.
Awesome, helpful prof. However the class is extremely hard. Grad students beware. If you got anything less than an A in undergrad calculus, CS510 will kill you.
A great professor and nice person.
He is helpful as far as the subject is concerned but not so if you are having administrative problems at Rutgers. And if you do all the homeworks you will be fine.
He's a good teacher. He'll show you how to write the whole program in class. We spent 2.5 weeks on Interpolation and had a week left over.
A teacher with a positive attitude & an actual personality. His homeworks & exams weren't as easy as I had wanted, but his lectures are worth going to.

gee, wonder who wrote that other review...
 he's really a great professor, but still isn't the easiest class, though not very hard either. don't be afraid of the matlab assignments. they're easy and they help
No Comments

Excellent Professor in RBS. Although she is only a Phd students in Rutgers. But she makes this class easy and funny. Maybe she is not that clear enough to teach the class material. But this class is super easy and hardly cant get an A. 3 easy exams(no cumulative), some easy homework and a group project. You should take this professor's class.

Naval was the TA for my comp apps class. He keeps you the entire class, sometimes even TWENTY minutes past. He likes to call on you if he thinks you're not paying attention. He's a bit confusing but his PPT'S make sense, he just doesn't know effective ways to teach Java. Very tough grader for the weekly assignments, points off for little things.
Good teacher. Enthusiastic to teach , and makes us work hard. Lectures are not boring but the exam are bit tough. He has always helped us with the assignments and his tips are useful.

She's grate professor.  Like to help and care about students.  She has e very easy and sample  way to teach. Very affected. I had her in 016 and she help me with my 119 class that I took with other professor. What the other teacher couldn't explain to me in 2 hours class she did in 5 minutes. I pass the test with  85. She is simple and effective.
Good Teacher, Does have a heavy accent, very helpful.
She was a good teacher, and she really knew her stuff. She did have a heavy Chinese accent, but she was very helpful.
He's Awesome
h3 IS m4D C0OL

Worst professor I've ever had. Impossible HW and in-class quizzes on material we covered same day. Exams are impossible because he twists the algorithms around and his wording is vague. Really disorganized with grading, I have no idea what my grades are on anything. Only positive is he has a nice curve, but i would never recommend this man.

I took Graduate level Algorithms with him and had a very very hard time coping up. The homeworks and exams were extremely hard. He lectures with his hand covering his mouth and is incoherent. His teaching/explanation wasn't easy to follow either. Please do yourself a favor, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM! He is very helpful and nice as a person

We are talking Michael Fredman here, Fibonacci Heap among other contributions. He is great, explaining, grading and testing. Exams are EASY if you understand the material and take your time, otherwise, you may have a hard time in general, not just with this class... usually CS == Algos. I highly recommend taking his class over newbies' ones.

Explains things very clearly most of the time. When he doesn't, he understands that, and the next class he'll explain another example or re-explain more clearly. Very helpful, as long as you ask. Midterm was easy (mostly application of explained algorithms), final was more difficult, but still fair. Ok, people tend to fail things, but he curves.
poor communication with students, very difficult exams
Very difficult exams, poor communication with students, very boring. He curves though.
Supper-Fly guy, but he is from PA so he cannot pronounce always
good guy. kinda hot
Literally cannot hear or understand his droning mumbling. Worthless as a teacher.
Sleepy lecturer, but slides were good and projects interesting.
Extremely boring and monotonous voice. If you end up taking him, be prepared to fall asleep as he injects no energy into his lectures. He is incredibly smart but has zero charisma to teach a class.
Highly not recommended! His lecture is useless for the exam. And he is an irresponsible teacher who cannot solve your questions at all.
An ez A. Lecture attendance is not mandatory. but u have to go to every recitation. Pro. Jt is a nice person, both lecture and recitation will give extra credits, up to 20 points.

This course can be tough in the first month when it goes over terminologies, but don't worry cuz it will get a lot easier after those. His lectures can be useful, so go for them although u don't have to show up. Lots of extra credits at the end, make sure u know how to get them. Relatively easy course.

One of the hardest intro courses I've ever taken. Material is not hard but requires a lot of grinding to grasp it. Elaborate assignments due every week! The class is called computer apps, but 75% of this course is computer programming through a language called "Scratch" . Do not take this course if you're not comfortable with computers or numbers.

People say this class is easy BUT if you have no interest in anything technology/programming wise it will be a burden! There's so many assignments due on FRIDAYS that are confusing, the information isn't hard but it's hard to grasp.. Just not a good class.

Go to class, do the assignments, do what you're told and you'll get a good grade.  His tests were simple enough and the scratch assignments were a lot of fun.  TAs are great too so if the prof. isn't enough, go to them.  extra credit available: got over a 100 in the class.
Sooo many assignments. Lectures are so boring.
Great guy, very good teacher.
Nice dude. Might try to come off tough some times but he's not. It's CS110 the class itself is a joke

JT is not really the professor of the class but rather a lecturer. He was helpful and posted all lectures online for students who couldn't make the class. This class is simple but the online assignments can be very time consuming. Exams were straight forward but very lengthy. Overall decent class, easy B+

Pretty easy class.  You really don't need to go to the classes, he posts his podcasts online with the slides from class.  Plus, the head of the computer department makes the exams, so as long as you do the reviews she posts, you'll do fine.

Super easy class. The online assignments pretty much teach you what you need to know/do, and he gives out a study guide before each exam. Some extra credit. Lectures are so-so but he's a nice guy who puts on music and walks around in bare feet in class.

His slides (in form of podcast) are all online. Lecture is sometimes long and boring...usually keeps u a few min later. Test is made by Kate, the head of CS110,they weren't too bad if you studied. Do all the HW!!

He teaches in his bare feet. So that shocked me at first but I soon discovered that as unconventional as he is, he is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He made some tough programming material seem so much easier. The course has a lot of work and the TAs seem hit or miss but overall I'd recommend it to others.

More programming in this class than I expected. Jt was an extremely good professor - very detailed, clear and tries to make the material interesting. His book is good too. Going to recitation is also helpful,
JT over simplifies in his lectures.  Be prepared to make the most out of your TA, and to watch Jt's podcasts instead of coming to class.

Great class. learned a bunch.  have to read the book and attend lecture if you want.  i learned mostly from recitation and from the book.  i got a A in the class.  for those of you who arent into computers i can see this as being a relatively hard class, but if you do all the work it shouldnt be too bad.
my dude jt teachin up a storm in his bare feet

Taking the course in the summer was a lot of work! But I got an A.  I give JT a lot of credit. He explained everything well and obviously cared about the material and how we did in the course. Excellent professor.

the programming half of the course was interesting since i have never seen how a computer worked before. the professor explained everything well. his book is excellent but his lectures were even more helpful.
Good class. Good Professor. Learned a lot.
Interesting man. Lectures are pretty boring, i've found myself falling asleep in class. Overall happy with how class went. Got an A

He's a good guy. I thought he was weird at first with wearing no shoes and messed up hair but I got over that because he explained everything we had to know for all of the exams very well. I also had a great TA but i know some people werent as lucky. I got an A with some work involved. There is homework every week though.

You have to stay on top of the work because something is due every week.  When I first saw him I thought he was too weird, but in the end I really respected him. I did well in the course because he explained everything so thoroughly. I have to admit, he is a very special Professor.
Easy A! JT's book, great lectures and podcasts tell you everything you need to do well ... he is easy going, laid back and knows how to teach. Best Prof I have had at Rutgers yet.

DONT TAKE THIS CLASS! Dont be fooled by the "Intro" to comp and app its not intro its fricken programming and you never no what the hell is going on cause he TAs don't speak english AT ALL!!This guy as not cut is hair EVER. Wears no shoes in class.Creeps on all the girls inc my girlfirend in front of me... he talks like he always has a clogged nose

this guy is the weridest man on campus. He does not wear shoes except for the exams and he looks like a bum. He has tried to hit on a couple of girls in class which makes him even weirder. His class is easy n you dont need to go to lecture just go to recitation n buy the JT book and you'll be fine
scieveeee him... put some shoes on, loser.

At first I was scared of the programming in this course but it was so rewarding to finally get a program to work. I ended up loving it.  I give a lot of credit to Jt, he really explained everything you needed to know. He is an oddball but going to his class is worth it.

HATE HATE HATEE this class!! i really had no intrest in computer apps but needed to take it for ex sci major. not too hard of a course tho, i pulled a B w.o much effort. JT is a good teacher, really knows his info, but the TA's BLOW! Nitya Vyas was terrible so if you get him as your TA good luck. grades are done in a point system so its not too bad

Prof. J.T. is a Rutgers legend. My mom had him when she went to Rutgers and tokld me to make sure I got him as a professor. I never listen to her but I ended up with J.T. anyway. I have to say, she was so right. he is great. Anyone who goes to Rutgers really should take his class.

Despite what JT warns on the first day, you really don't have to attend most of the lectures. There is no attendance taken,the class is worth it to fill a math req. If you have an ok knowledge of computer code/computers it's a go. Just get full credit on homework and get okay grades on the exams, though I have to say the final was very hard.
dont bother going to class, just read the book and study a day in advance for the exams and you should be fine...just make sure you do all the homework and do not fall behind
Very good professor ... explained everything well. Would not have made it through the course without him. Loved his book too. Course is not for everyone though.

great!!! The first time I took the course I had another prof. who knew nothing. JT was so much better. he knows his stuff, explains it well, helped me finally get a good grade. nice guy. Get JT if you take the course.

Jt is very good. Class is hard because of all the work but I learned a lot. Jt is great at presenting the material and seemed like a great guy. He is unusual but that is cool. He was very enthusiastic and seemed to care. I feel if  had a different professor I would not have done as well.

wow. i happen to really like JT! this class was child's play. it even fulfilled my second math requirement! one of our assignments was to draw a picture on the paint computer program. this class was beyond easy. i'd recommend it to everyone
This class is a complete WASTE OF TIME.  You will be a slave for this class for the whole semester.  The TAs do not speak English, and JT is way too boring.  Avoid he class at all cost.
WORST class ever. It should just be called computer programming. thats all you are tested on in the final. Lecture is the worst and none of the TA's speak english.

ok.. I liked JT in the beginning, but by the end, he had an attitude with everyone in the class.  This one girl had a question because there was an inconsistency with the date that all of our stuff was due (the TA's said another date) and he started yelling that we should only listen to him.  I don't care because I got an A with the help of my TA!
No Comments

Jt knows his stuff on computers and the book he writes on the programs you are required to do is very helpful, but I'd rather read the book then listen to hs BORING lectures. O my!!!! The worst...He is not helpful at all, if you need help rely on the TA's office hrs...if you have a helpful TA. The class requires alot of time...so if you want to pas
So boring! Two exams. I got an A and D and ended up with a C+ despite having done perfect on A LOT of hw assignments and gotten extra credit.  the final is mad hard. study!!

The course is useless except to fill the math requirement, unless you actually care about True BASIC. He tries to compensate for a mediocre teaching style by going over every point in painfully simplistic terms. You can ace this class if you read the textbook and screw around with the software on your own, even if you skip lectures.

Well designed course. Jt is very organized and cares about what he teaches. One of best Profs at Rutgers. The textbook he wrote is great. He makes podcasts of all lectures available. If you take CS110, make sure you get in his lecture.

algebra or "wats a kompooter", right?Stale and boring, why half the course is programming idiocy is beyond me. 8 page intro of dos and donts, dull repetition, 'busy work', not very helpful or respectful prof, and $120 in worthless books.with TAs it can be a huge hit or miss.  pluses = class only an hour long, easy exams, minimal attendence rec.

GET OVER THE SHOES GUYS! Jees!  1 midterm, 1 final, and a crapload of assignments. If math isn't your thing take it as an alternative.  The exams have gotten harder but try your best.  MAKE SURE YOU DO ALL OF YOUR ASSIGNMENTS! If you do them all and get C's on your exams you'll still pass with a B.

The bottom of his feet are black from walking around barefoot all of the time. He is definitely a weird one. Always goes past the time that class ends. Tests are hard but they give review sheets. He is a good teacher and is very thorough at explaining things, some times too thorough. Doesn't take attendance or care if you come late.

This is what too much Star Trek, Star Wars, and Lord of the Rings will produce.  The dude is cool but looks like he has dressed up like Jedi one too many times.  But a great professor and doesn't wear shoes....thats kinda cool.  He is one of the cooler of the computer geeks, not that there is anything wrong with computer geeks!

VERY BOARING!! Be prepaired to move all your stuff to the computer lab cause you'll be living there for the semester. Lectures are boaring. Good time to sleep. I didn't even notice that he wasn't wearing shoes! He dresses up for exams though.
why doesn't he wear shoes it really is a insult to all the students. But the class is boring at first and then becomes extremely hard and boring if you don't know or care how to program.
40% of his class gets an A. You really can't complain that it's hard in front of the statistic. Practice programming is the key, although I never really read his book until later chapters.
JT's awesome! Nice guy, helpful if you go to him. Class can be difficult, a good TA is key. You'll be spending alot of time in the Comp Lab! Exams are tough, beware!!!

awesome guy. explains things very clearly for the benefit of people who arent so computer literate -- so if you're a computer person, you might get a little bored. but he rules and helps when he is available. he also plays really saucy music before and after class. definitely take his class.
your TA's are you best shot at the class his book sucks he really needs to update it and learn how to spell
Never had JT's class, but he's a cool guy to work for in the computer labs.  Manages all the CCF labs on campus.

OK, who is giving this guy bad ratings?  Can you ask for an easier proff?  I mean, the first assignment is to email your TA.  You just can't ask for an easier class.  The only problem is that its too easy.  Don't listen to Rutgers advisors if they tell you to take this class before cs 111.

Ok, so he's a dirty hippie...but he is an excellent programming teacher (even if it is retard programming)...people who get less than an A in this class are absolute morons, because he makes it fool-proof. And his notes are the new bible. (although i still dont ge tthe bandana thing)

He's very thorough and organized, makes material easy to understand, and as long as you do assignments and pay attention it's an easy class. i say rock on to his being unique, we have enough dull profs!

he's a really good teacher, is really clear with his explainations...he listens to kooky music and doesn't wear shoes, but is really nice and you can tell he knows what he is talking about and wants to teach students
JT is a good guy! the class is not too hard but if you have any difficulty he is more than willing to help. it is great to fulfill your math req. and his book is pretty funny.
he was good the class is interesting, tine required, but its cool

JT is okay....afterall he write the book. course is very time consuming. recitation is a must, assignments on programming take awhile, but if u have a good TA u will be fine. (Neville Clemens kix bootay :-) ) good class to use to fulfill math requirement!
I liked him. if you pa attention he's really good.

Jt is a very good teacher in my opinion. Even though he has to move quickly sometimes in the beginning for the Applications area, he tries to explain everything to his best within the time given. He does the same for BASIC.
This stupid mofo with long hair thinks he a goat or some sort. He thinks he rules the world or something. He is not that bad at teaching, but unfortunately he thinks he is tougher than God himself.

The Man Doesn't Wear Shoes!!! (kinda weird) A little effort for all the work and prorgams , but not hard.  some of the projects take time, and you have to use MAC's sometimes.  (booo!) But He wrote the textbook and it's kinda funny.
Class was easy if you did this before, otherwise not all to easy...if you took basic before i recommend you take it, itll be an easy A, otherwise if its not required....

JT is vwey easygoing..just go to the lectures and listen to him..try to follow his examples..do the homework..and you will do fine in the class...even though there is a considerable amount of homework in this class..i would still rate is as a fun class..

CS110 is the worst class ever it is 100 level and 3 credits when it should be at least a 300 level and 4 credits with the amount of time you put into this class. JT does his best to explain programming yet, its not very approachable outside of lecture....

JT may be different than others, but he is a VERY BAD teacher.  His class was the most difficult i have ever had and he is not nice at all when you are one on one.  Unless ur going to be a computer scientist, DONT BOTHER!

JT is very nice and makes you feel so comfortable in his class. His class is an easy, providing you do all the homework. And his "weirdness" is quite refreshing from the usual stuffy, hard-ass, not-wanting-to-help-students professors that are th

This is probably the worst teacher I have ever had.  He is VERY difficult and does not provide much help.  He enjoys making people feel as though they can't pass his class and he is very strange.  He wrote the book used in class so is VERY specific.

HE TEACHES BAREFOOT!!!

I am so glad I got him as a T.A. He helped me so much, even if it was outside of class. He is funny, makes class interesting, and explains everything very well. He really knows his stuff and is the best out of the TAs for the class. He is the lead TA and I understand why

Try to not have him as a T.A. At least for my semester he's harshest grader out of all T.As. I would say he is a little arrogant maybe because he's the youngest out of all T.As but really that attitude was not necessary. One good thing is that he doesnt make recitation that boring.

Very helpful guy but his classes were a bit boring and he made many mistakes when showing us different things. Easy grader but misses some mistakes, especially on exams. It is great to have a higher great but it sucks later on when somebody else grades your work.
Very helpful guy, and will help you with the homework and pretty much any other problem you have. You should be able to get a good grade as long as you actually do the homework and Niko is your TA.
He's a real programmer so he was able to help out with a lot. He made everything really clear and easy to understand.  Also very willing to help outside of class. Really chill, get him if you can!
Great TA, very helpful and patient. totally recommended!
Very helpful TA, teaches and really helps you understand any program language. Take him for all recs!
Real chill TA! Def a TA i enjoyed having :)
BEST PROF. EVER!!!
Great TA, super helpful! Awesome grader!

Excellent professor. He's very organized, helpful, and wants you to do well - and provides everything you need in order to do so. Just go to lecture and do the non-mandatory homeworks, and you'll do fine. You learn a LOT of very useful things, but without the unnecessary stress so common in Rutgers CS classes. Couldn't have asked for more!
Great professor!

Lots of extra credit, just pray you get an easy TA. Lectures are SO boring. Try to find an old exam to get examples from. Exams I got 67, 50 and 91 on final. (literally didnt do a quarter of the 2nd one, also didnt study) Got a C+ ...do the extra credit. Not that bad of a class.

Textbook is totally unnecessary. Really funny guy, class is pretty easy as long as you get a chill TA, beware though, they do  make mistakes occasionally when grading exams. You can get a B/B+ with little effort and an A with a decent amount of effort.

If he does teach this class again (he is leaving), don't buy the textbook, don't worry about attending lecture, do the assignments to the best of your ability, and study for the tests.  You will get an A.

Go to lecture and pay attention, do the homework assignments and you will get an A. The book is unnecessary, everything you need to know can be found online. 3 exams total and a spreadsheet mini exam. Put a bit of effort in and you ll be fine!

He teaches the material well and is very clear. There are weekly Sakai assignments that are graded by your TA. There are 3 exams, 2 midterms and a final. The hardest part of the class is the coding, it can be tedious.

Very kind and clear professor. Appenzeller is always willing to help and answer questions. Go to lecture: he does some examples in class that he doesn't put on sakai and there is ec for attendance. Most of the assignments take a lot of time, so start them early. Exams are fair and an A is possible.

He's a great guy and if you just study what he tells you to you will do fine. The assignments can be rough and are annoying to complete, but so much extra credit is given even if you have a low grade the EC is bound to boost it to atleast a B. Got an A but did have to put in the effort.
don't buy the textbook cause you will never use it. He's kinda sarcastic and snooty, but he knows his stuff. The class isn't difficult at all.

Great Professor! Clear with all lectures, answers all questions and concerns. Gives extra credit, but you must work hard to get that A! A lot of time and effort might have to be put into this course. It is pretty easy once you get it, and you should make study partners because it helps A LOT. Such a smart man.

SO DIFFICULT. IF YOU PUT IN ENOUGH EFFORT, YOU WILL GET THAT A!! This will be a part of your life for a whole semester due to all the homework, but overall, once you understand it, it will be a piece of cake. Prof. is SO HOT. Good lecture, and good extra credits. Be sure to attend class!

I had to work pretty hard to get an A but I am generally not very good with computers. A lot of people got As though( like 30% of the class or more); he posts the rating at the end. As for his style, he is not your typical college professor, but a real world professional,very young sharp sarcastic but approachable(nice combination)Liked him a lot!

the assignments take a lot of time, so start on them early & ask your TA for help if you need it. he asks the same question types as old exams if you can get ahold of them, same for homework. do the extra credit, he explains things pretty clear and is an interesting humorous teacher, you have to put in the time if you want an A, not hard material

Comp Apps. NOT an easy A, but if you give an honest effort, you can get a B. A lot of information to learn. Nice/chill guy. Assign's require time. Do the extra credit! (They help.) Lecture is expendable, go to recitation. Read the book for the 1st exam it's a wake up call. Exams are kind of difficult. The material isn't THAT hard but requires time.

This class is not an easy A, but I would say that anyone who gives at least a little effort could get a B. A lot of time has to be put into homework and studying for exams but they are pretty straightforward. Appenzeller is a really nice guy and gives a lot of extra credit. Go to lecture because he tells you exactly what will be on the exam.
Charming guy,well-organized lectures, not an easy A though:it takes time to do homeworks and make sure you prepare for the exams.
Easily one of the best professors I've had at Rutgers. Lectures and classes are very organized and straight-forward. TA wasn't bad either.

Great professor. Very straight forward. I must admit he has dry humor, but at least he tries. You have to attend lecture and recitation if you want an A, it's as simple as that. OH, AND TONS OF EXTRA CREDIT OPPORTUNITIES!

Good professor, and a nice guy;he is  young,smart and  down-to-earth.The lectures are detailed, but recitaions are kind of short, my TA was nice, but I didn't get much out of them. Homeworks are time-consuming, exams are reasonable, but the second one felt long(not enough time). Overall good class,take him.
good amount of work is given, if you are not on track of things, you won't get an A. however an average zoo animal could probably get a B in this class without attending a single lecture.
Great professor. Easy A if you go to most of the classes and do all homeworks. He is very sarcastic and keeps the class alert and interested. Favorite teacher at Rutgers.

Great class. Weekly assignments due friday noon. Random attendance taken but it is for extra credit and after you've been called you are clear for the next few ones as it's ordered. Exams are very straightforward and reasonable as long as you do the weekly assignments on your own and understand how to do them.
Really easy class, takes attendance every class, picks 20-30 people randomly. Can be funny, but the material isn't that hard.  He's a nice guy, and is willing to help.

Great professor. Don't underestimate the coursework though. Do the homework assignments and you'll be fine. Random attendance. Seems ordered though so you'll be good for a couple lectures once he calls your name.

Great professor, makes the material very clear and easy to understand. Exams are very fair and easy overall. I recommend taking this professor if you have the chance. Answers any questions about assignments and has a review before each exam.

Really easy class and nice professor. His lectures can be a little dry but they aren't necessary to do well in the class, though he does random attendance checks and gives extra credit. Should be an easy A if you can do the homework.
Very easy class. Appenzeller lays out exactly what you need to know. Does not expect too much from non-CS students. Would definitely recommend!
Out of the six courses you have to take to get into business school this is by far the easiest. Make sure you take him. Dont buy the book because its not necessary at all.
Very fair teacher, very fair exams. Gives a good deal of extra credit. Do all the work on time and it should be an easy A

AMAZING! Absolutely loved him. I personally hate technology because they piss me off easily but this was the best class I had. EASY if you do all your work on time. TAKE HIM! Hes funny and knows his stuff. Really helpful and this is a great class for beginners. First exam had an average of 86 or so. He just makes all the material worth it. LOVE HIM
He has very good clarity and doesn't overcomplicate the material.  Listen for your name though because he sometimes only calls it once.  Awesome dry sense of humor that few can truly appreciate.

I came into this class knowing the material, which made it easier for me. However, it really is not a hard class at all for beginners. READ and do online assignments on time! Also, you get up to 25 extra-credit points. Exams are a bit long. However, as long as you keep up with the class, it will be very easy.
Very Helpful.
who really cares about students ability to learn

Definitely one of my top five professors at Rutgers. The class was already interesting but was made infinitely more so by the project (a Java-based BitTorrent client) and Rob's seemingly infinite knowledge of all things CS. A must-take for any CS major.
Best professor I EVER had in college. His lectures made sense. He answered every students question. His exams were do-able. The hw assignments were lengthy, but great. Too bad he had to leave. :(
best professor, very helpfull, understand very well his material and love teaching

Good teacher.  He isn't easy, but he's easier than Sesh.  If the class is well-haved, he's a really nice guy.  I did hear that if people start talking during lecture that he can get a bit mean though.  Overall, he's better than alot of others in CS.

Very hard for students who are writers and abstract thinkers (english, media, art, etc.) but he really explains the material well and gives you so many opportunities to get extra help. He often does examples in class and goes through each and every step. The exams are difficult, but going to the review sessions will def. improve your performance.
Great Professor! Sometimes class can be a little boring, but the notes are very helpful for the projects. The projects are very enjoyable to do
Very interesting class.

Though he can get a big boring in class, he's a great teacher and his exams are extremely fair - they're pretty much identical to his practice exams so if you have a strong grasp on the practice questions, you'll do fine in the exams.
Wonderful professor.  Best CS class I took at Rutgers.
VERY BORING and monotone. I stopped going to class cause I slept better in SERC reading room. But he did give me a C instead of a D so I'd stop bothering him so he's good to go in my book!

I wish I could agree with the reviewers from earlier years but his english is not acceptable for a professor these days.Average grade on midterm was 62, final was 92 because the department probably put a lot of pressure on him after many complaints about his poor communication skills.The book was not much help either,so expect to go to office hours
Very easy professor. Exams are easy. Take him.
Brilliant guy.  You'll learn in his class.
A great thinker and he let you know how to think. What else can you expect?

R.I.P Prof Sergio

Sergio is an awesome guy in general. The best thing about his class was that he videotapes lectures. This was so helpful that it should be mandated in every course in the future. It allows students who missed class to get the same education as those who did, and if you missed something in class you have the entire lecture at your fingertips.

He was my TA for 205. I learned more from him in his recitation than I did in lecture. Tapes classes which is great. He is easy to understand because he explains the material at a good pace. I strongly recommend him.

I had him as a TA for CS206. One of the best teachers around hands down! He filmed the recitations and posted the videos online. Extremely helpful in office hours! He has the ability to explain complicated material in such a way that he makes it look almost too easy. His teaching style is excellent. Taking him is a must. You will not regret it.

An amazing teacher for discrete structures. He is very clear, explains really well, and actually makes this dull subject interesting. He records his lectures so going to lecture is not mandatory. The tests are hard but he does this so he can spread out the grades, expect a curve. Take this class if you want to learn and have a great teacher!

Sergio is a GREAT teacher.  He's Portugese and has an accent, but his English is perfect and his clarity trumps that of most teachers I've ever had.  His homework is easy for the most part, but the exams are more difficult.  He records lectures and posts them online so you can view them later if necessary.  AWESOME guy!

Even though there is a ton of material you have to study, he explains everything very well in lecture. Sometimes it gets a little dry, but the prof cares about his students and will go the extra mile to help out. Exams are essay based and somewhat hard, but if you dedicate the time, you'll be fine. Just be prepared to study long hours.

Great lecturer, wants you to be involved.  Lecture doesn't drag on like most courses in these majors. Plus, his accent is hot (if you're a girl) and if you're a guy, his accent is soothing to listen to during lecture, ha!
One of my favorite professors! Lectures were extremely well organized, and definitely worth going to. I learned a lot from him.

Has online lecture notes, but keeps taking them down before exams.  I don't know if this is intentional for some bizzarre reason or what, but copy the notes to your computer as soon as you can if you want to use them to study.

He uses Thu Nguyen's projects for HW, so expect to do more work than any class you've ever taken.  But if you make the sacrifice, you'll laern to program C really well and be a better overall CS guy.  As for lectures, they are skippable.  But if you go, you won't need to study as much.

Best teacher I've had at Rutgers.  He was incredibly clear and really knew his stuff. It is a lot of work, but he tells you this at the start.  If you do the homework and are interested in programming, then exams are pretty easy.

Pradip has been my favorite professor so far. He really knows how to teach, and he really makes you understand what exactly is going on. He is difficult, but I guarantee you that you will understand whats going on.
One of the best computer science professors in the school. He will help you if you ever need it.

This class had a lot of homework and recitation attendance is manditory (which is irritating). The exams are easy, the homework is medium difficulty.

He's been my favorite teacher at RU. Knows his stuff and how to teach it. Enjoys talking with students and giving that extra little effort to answer questions, even during lecture, and never runs over the hour twenty.

hes awesome. class is challenging but fun.  I recommend taking it with him. he cares abt his students and answers their questions.  very prompt with emails. very professional and approachable.

hes the best prof i'll have thruout my journey at RU..hes very approachable and helpful, one of the nicest ppl..great teaching style..dun be intimidated by him..hes extremely helpful..i wish he taught more CS courses

Hari is one of the best teachers I've ever had.  He is extremely clear and tries to make sure everyone gets everything before moving on.  Don't assume he won't help, ask him for some extra help if you need, he's great like that.  And ask questions in class. The class is hard, but he made an A possible.
99% will agree..amazing teacher.  He speaks and somehow I automatically know it.

Might be the best CS professor at Rutgers! He makes class relaxing and easy to understand. He's very patient with his students too. No CS experience required cos he walks you through everything at your pace. Make sure you do the homework cos the exams are basically the HW problems but even easier. Easy A if you do the work.

Professor Hari's class is very fair and easy as long you do the homework. Exams come from simplified homework problems. I would not recommend taking this class because of its ease but to get taught by one of the best professors I have had at Rutgers University. Professor Hari is not only eloquent but teaches the subject in a very understandable way

Class is easy as****. I did every homework no problem in like 3 hours max. Absolutely no computer science experience. Just go to all the lectures, do all the homeworks, and be careful on the tests and this class is a breeze.

In my educational career, there have been a few instructors that have either stood out as being exceptionally good, or horrendously bad. P Hari is in the top of the top, well spoken, gives clear examples in class, and is genuinely interested in both the subject and his students.
Great Professor. Goes over everything that is necessary. It is recommended that you know how to program a little,  else the textbook will be your new best friend.

He is an amazing teacher.. extremely intelligent, very organized, makes sure that everyone has understood whatever he is teaching,knows  how to deal with intelligent qns or dumbest qn ever..and a very beautiful small human being..However, this class is hard and  I wouldn't recommend it unless you have had some programming experience..

So far I've had prof Hari for 111 and 112. Through both courses he's been incredibly helpful. He is very willing to help students who are having problems and is one of the fairest prof's I've had. If you have the opportunity to take a course with him as the prof I definitely recommend it.

Unless you already know java, do NOT take this class. Hari will not answer any questions, just refers you to the website which does NOT provide answers on syntax. You basically have to teach yourself the class. He's completely useless. VERY arrogant. I dont know what everyone here is smoking rating this guy well. AWFUL teacher, STAY AWAY!!!

This guy is pretty arrogant whenever he answers questions. He gives homework which is impossible to do unless you already know java. He doesn't give any of the hava commands you're going to need so its basically a figure it out yourself class. Google is definitely no help when figuring out the syntax of a program. Trial and error takes forever.

He is very helpful, very nice. And all the problems in the exams came from the homework. So make sure to do all the homework problems. This course requires you to think so, don't expect to be easy. But, the professor is really helpful and answers all your questions.
Professor Hari's method of teaching will work for everyone. He is also very fair and reasonable. Hot as hell too
Professor Hari is great! He is the most fair and professional instructor that I have ever come into contact with. He makes CS111 interesting and challenging. I would suggest taking it with him.

I first met Professor Hari in CS111, and because of him, I've decided to take CS112 with him and do a CS minor.  He can speak eloquently, extremely intelligent, very humorous and good humored, very approachable, and has more patience than any other human being I've ever met.  Plus, he's good looking and he always smells good.

He is extremely knowledgeable in computer science, this maybe why this class was so difficult. The projects are a mix of trying to adapt more advanced cs concepts and using data structures. He has good intentions but the rest of the world, sadly to say, is not as intelligent as he. I believe they finally use a better book now. Best of luck.
He is very clear and helpful during office hours. He is willing to listen to his students and has a good attitude.

I've read a lot of disparaging comments about P.Hari for CS111. People are bitter about not getting partial credit. Unfortunately in the read CS world, your program either works or it doesn't. The user will never know how to fix it for themselves. College is about preparing for the real world, get used to it.

He is a very good teacher. Homeworks are only 10% of final grade but most important. This was first computer course I've ever taken, and ended up with A because homworks tickled my brain and his lecture was clear and made sense.
smart n helpful...

This was my first computer science class and I did pretty good with the help of this excellent teacher.  He keeps a really professional attitude and helps you as much as he can;  all you have to do is ask.  The class ranges from people with no computer knowledge to experts and he's really good at being able to address everyone's needs.

I didn't do the best in this class (ended up with my first C+) but Hari is a great professor. The material is difficult, especially for those of us whom have never seen java before but he explains it as clearly as possible and responds quickly to e-mails. Definately need to make time to review with your TA. Math majors may want to check out CS107.
Entertaining lecturer. Definitely knows how to deal with the dumbasses.

Definately the best teacher I've ever had.  Always helpful and understanding.  If you took CS in high school, this class will be a breeze.  If you didn't, Pradip is certainly good enough to get you started.

I've had Hari for two semesters and he is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He will spend a lot of time trying to help you understand a problem. He is passionate about teaching effectively and is genuinely concerned about his students. Assignments do require a lot of student effort, but as long as you don't give up quickly they are doable.

Professor Hari is very clear and makes sure that everyone understands how he got to a certain answer and what he did along the way. With that said, this is a very challenging course and attending recitations and completing homework assignments is necessary to do well in this class. His organization and teaching style are very helpful.

PRADIIIIPP is awesome. he's indian but you can understand what he says and he speaks with good clarity. he can handle the complete idiots in the class that keep asking retarded questions. he can help you with anything if you ask. the class is challenging but fun, but you must do the homework assignments. pradip the man.

I have had the pleasure of having Professor Hari for 2 semesters. In addition to being a brilliant man, he is a fantastic teacher. If you don't understand something, don't be afraid to ask. He will spend any time you need after class and he also stop during lecture to take questions. People who don't like the class, :-( too bad, but dont hate hari!

pradip is one of my favorite professors so far, in lecture he spends a lot of time making sure everyone in class understands the topics covered. he is willing to answer any questions during class. exams and assignments are pretty easy however you might feel like they are graded unfairly but they are not. in the end, great professor.

The class itself requires a lot (A LOT!) of work, but if you go to class and keep up with it you'll be fine. Hari explains things clearly and is really responsive when people ask questions in class.  Yeah, if you don't have to take CS111, don't.  But if you do, hope for Hari.

Easiest class ever.  As long as you go to recitation and pay attention in lecture there is no reason you should not get an A for the course.  Also multiple easy extra credit oppotunities

This guy is the best. Makes a dull lecture fun by cracking jokes. Class is somewhat fast-paced but some studying will resolve that. Recitations will vary by who you get. The tests are tricky and will freak people out, but it all evens out with the huge amount of extra credit. Pay attention in class and it will pay off with less studying later.

great and funny professor, can't help but like him. recitations are fast-paced (i guess it depends on who you have) so don't get lost or fall behind. exams were fair but some questions were long and tough but the t.a's are very lenient and give you points for attempting the problem. YAY VINAY!

AWESOME PROFESSOR.  Calls 15 random names in beginning of lecture for attendance, which is EC.  A lot of people leave class right after the names are called, but he doesn't mind, and loves it when you at least wave goodbye to him.  Exams are fully based on lecture slides which are on sakai, and on what you learn in recite. Easy A if you study.
Great teacher and easy class.  Recommended for an easy A.  I didn't study for the final and got a 93.  Lectures are boring but the slides he posts are what he goes over in class.
Pretty easy. You just needa do the weekly assignment which can be annoying and time consuming. But if you do those you'll be alright. You gotta study for the exams tho! The final was pretty hard.

i learned a lot in a class I had no prior interest in. The assignments can be difficult, but he and his TAs do a good job at helping you through everything. I haven't had a professor at Rutgers who has actually cared about teaching their students until Stout. If he taught more classes, i would switch my major to Comp Science.

He's such a great professor! Reeeeally funny and a great lecturer!!...he won't bore you to death. Overall, the class was kind of easy to get an A in, but for me, it was because of the weight of the weekly assignments (which took HOURS at times ugh javascript) and extra credit opportunities. Exams were  extremely fair.
HE DA BOMBB. I LOVE HIM. SO HELPFUL ND EASY. GETTING A LOT HARDER OVER YEARS

succhhh an easy prof! had him for comp apps for business, go to recitation bc u learn everything there, if u ask him for help after class he helps u fo ur assignment, got an A! barely went to class but didnt miss a recitation!
This teacher has to be by far the best teacher i have met at Rutgers! Easy course,both the teacher and the TA's are extremely helpful! HIGHLY RECOMMEND taking him for CS 170- only class he teaches!
he's hilarious and helpful; he encourages you to come to office hours.  easy A.  a lot of hw, but the TA's help you out on most of it.

easy class. attendance isn't mandatory. never went to class, missed half the recitations, but still got an a. homeworks are fairly easy, but easier if you go to recitations cause the TA practically does it for you. no need for the book, slides say it all.

This guy is definitely one of the coolest professors I had so far.  He's not some old boring lecturer, but funny and very helpful.  The class is very easy as long as you study before the exams, and do all the assignments carefully.  Hands down the least stressful business pre-req I had because it was such an easy A.

Easy class, he is a funny guy but going to lecture isnt necessary at all. All exams are from the lecture slides for the most part, some little things from the book. TAs are usually easy graders, not hard to get an A if you study before exams

Highly recommended. Interesting, funny, makes things life applicable, some personality, helps explain things with no problem and it usually works. The course is not tough (comp app for bus) just do all of the homeworks, and study. Just watch out for JavaScript. Sometimes ends class early; and its not one of those dreadful environments.
Really funny guy and a great teacher as well. Presents material very clearly making it easy to learn. Definitely take!
Stout is great! He's a really nice professor and he wants his students to do well.  He does a great job explaining things, and will clarify any concepts to help students out.

He's got a great sense of humor. Interesting prof and is always willing to help. Exams are quite easy but you still need to study. With the extra credit work and homeworks, it's easy to get an A. I enjoyed this class a lot! :)

Easy class, clear in teaching don't really need to go to class just keep up with whatever he is teaching.Exams are fairly straightforward and hes really willing to help if you need it.Lectures are ok, not too bad, but theres no curve not that you really need it anyways.Take him.
WORST CLASS EVER. YOU LEARN A COMPUTER LANGUAGE THAT ISN'T EVEN USED.

NOT AN EASY CLASS! When I took Intro to Computer & Applications, I knew absolutely nothing about computers. My T.A., Andrew Timmes was extremely helpful; if not for him, I would have failed.  Class material, homework,projects were very difficult and time consuming. The final was impossible - I failed it. With all my hard work, I only earned a "B".

easy class...i never went to class...and rarely to recitation.....first exam was easy, which was all true basic....second was no basic and all information and excel....and the third was all basic and on databases...homework every week that can be hard, but if you hand it in you will get full credit...so many extra credit opportunities...overall ok.

ok, honestly, the people on here are ridiculous. this class is by far the easiest class i have taken at rutgers. I knew NOTHING about computers and got an A. Prof Goelz is so happy and energetic and will help you if you need it. But trust me all you have to do is go to recitation and you'll be fine. SO EASY

Hardest class I've taken at Rutgers. It's NOT about computers and how to use them. It's 70% TRUE BASIC programming queries, logic and formulas. My lecturer was Jt(boring and smug) I had a TA who, although he was a lovely person, not a great teacher and there was a HUGE language barrier. WEekly assignments and you're forced to use ancient MAC apps.
most anal teacher ever. doesnt answer any questions during the exam and accuses random people of cheating. i had a bad experience with her class and dont recommend her as a teacher

She is one of the better CS110 teachers. If you go to class she will help you learn the material if you are struggling and put forth some type of effort. Also the problems she goes over in class are just like the ones on the exams. I knew nothing about computers when i took this class. All i did was attend class and read the JT book and i got an A.

Easy class, BAD PROFESSOR Luckily the TA is mainly in charge of grading and such. Repeats a bunch of crap in her lectures, but you don't have to go. You focus on practice problems then you would need definitions for the midterm/final! My grade was almost an F because her and my TA screwed up when I got a B. Find another if you can.

she is the worst professor ever. she will do anything to give you a ZERO... thats her job. she doesnt give a sh*t about her students. she just wants you to get a zero. HORRIBLE professor. please do not EVER take her.

Doesn't give a sh!t about you. If you e-mail her, she'll respond with cryptic 3 word answers. If you take a makeup exam, she'll put you in a room next to her office by yourself, leave you there for 2 hours and LEAVE the building and not tell you where she is. I ended up having to slip my exam underneath her office door after waiting for an hour.

Easiest teacher ever.  No need for the textbook other than JT. basically common sense if you dont get a B or above in this class you shouldn't even be in college.  Don't complain about the weekly homework assignments because if you look into the JT book there are examples that are exactly what the homework asks for.
This class really is not that hard. Its just that weekly assignments can kill your mid-week drinking. Take this class with someone other than her, she does know her material I guess.

This lady is the spawn of satan. She gives horrible unorganized notes, she rants about nothing in lecture, cares nothing about her students, shes lazy, and she'll use any excuse to give you a zero on your exam. I think this lady is half retarded.... but it is an easy course. I recommend taking a different professor.

ok. this class is the worst. the TA's do not speak much english, therefore they are not that helpful. There is HW every week, some which requires a lot of help. Student Beware. this class is not reccomended if you want an east A, B, or C.
Horrible teacher, but understands what shes talking about. The class is easy tho... just do the hw.

Easiest class I've taken at RU so far. In class it seems as though she's not the brightest teacher but if you talk to her one on one you'll understand that she knows what she's talkin about. Programming can be tricky but easy with a little bit of practice. Tests are extremely easy. Just do all homework and youll get an A.

Intro to comp apps...  what a joke.  First of all the class is really easy, just d othe homework and you'll get at least a B.  Goelz.  She is dumb.  She knows her stuff but for a comp-apps teacher she really doesn't have her stuff together.  Can never get the projector to work with her MAC tha she insists insn't the problem :rolleyes:
Her lectures are boring and uninformative, don't bother going, but the TAs are helpful with the hw and preparing for the exams. Take another professor if you want an easy A.
Nice lady, easy class if you keep up with the assignments...but she is the most boring person EVER. Thank god I had Arnav for my TA, he was awesome and so helpful :)

The class I found very easy. Anyone with working knowledge of computers will pass without difficulty. If computers aren't your thing, take this course with another professor, because Goelz and her team of wonder TAs aren't very helpful.

Okay the TA's suck and hardly speak english. The class was not easy! Do not buy all the books! Only buy Jt's conversation w/ True Basic and Technology in Action. The other ones she says u need but believe me you don't. I got an A in the class so it is possible. Just make sure u do all the assisignments and make sure u know what u doing on the exams

her class is sooooo boring, i mean wow, i count down towards the end, the class itself is ok...just do well on the hw and do semi ok on the exams, and u'll be fine....cant stand this stupid requirement class....thank god its almost over

Hated her, hated her class. The TAs were really helpful but the professor totally spoiled it for everyone. The most pointless college requirement I've ever had to take. Not the most sociable professor around. Must have had a personality bypass years ago.

Boooring lectures.  TA makes or breaks the course.  If you ace all the HW and get 80s on the midterm and final like me you can still get an A in the course.  But make sure to do well on the HW!  It really helps.  BASIC programming gets hard later on though.

Goelz is not the brightest teacher.  She gets her point across but you could probably learn it better on your own. My TA was amazing, Shankar S., knew exactly what was on the exams and explained it better than Kate! Def take the class, it's not hard at all :-D
All the below is true but she has the WORST TA's. If you get Vasu for recitation, just sign out of the class. It's not worth it.

easiest class you will ever take, but with the ****est professor.  she hates everyone and will do anything she can to make you feel as dumb as possible. dont need to go to lectures, we spent the first month learning how to use the internet.
I think I knew more than she did going into this class.  Easy course, easy A but if you have no clue about computers I'd find another professor.

most people on here are right. goelz isnt the brightest bulb in the socket when it comes to teaching. but then again the class is not that hard to begin with. all you have to do is do the homework and know how to trace programs, & go to recitation. easy A
don't take her class, shes terrible at teaching for college level, young kids would be better

comp sci sux, the class meets at night or early morning, long lectures about how to type and teacher is mean, i stopped going to class and just used first class notes and studied at home and got an A
She is a very boring teacher with pointless lectures but the exams are very easy and so are the homeworks. There is also a lot of extra credit.

Coming into this class, I knew nothing about computers. I came out of this class the same way. The lectures were completely pointless. The recitations were made tough by my TA who didn't cut as any slack.Goelz shouldnt be a professor
Lectures are pointless and I constantly fall asleep. Exam's and homework have been easy so far. Pretty easy class. Take It!

All I have to say is duh... She has no clue what she is talking about period! I feel like my intellect is drained just by going to her lectures. She would be an awesome kindergarten teacher, but isn't fit to teach ANYTHING in college

Good professor.  Lectures are clear, sometimes a bit dry. Class actually stays on schedule. Labs are tough, and a little mind-bending, but worth it.

I knew programming coming into this class, so I got a B+ otherwise I would have failed. His lectures were boring and useless. Homework wasnt so bad and counted a lot. Attendance was for bonus points. Exams were not made by him and he made it obvious he didnt want to teach the class.
omg he's the most borring man alive! I actually fell asleep in class several times and that's never happened in any other class before. He spends like 20 minutes on each slide! X(
He takes his time going over his lecture notes, which is why he can be little boring time to time. Other than that, he's okay.

He is a pretty good professor in the CS department.  Basically goes over his slides, then lets you go, also answers questions rather well.  His exams and programming assignments are pretty easy for the level; I was expecting much harder.  I heard he treats his 111 students like crap though.
No Comments

Prof. McCarty seems like an okay teacher. He likes to take his time with subjects, which could potentially mean very long boring lectures. He hates teaching CS111, though, and likes to make fun of CS111 students. He treats CS314 students better.

he takes his time teaching and still noone understands because he is teaching from 10 year old notes that don't make much sense even if you understand programming to begin with (get into morris' lecture, he's a good guy and he makes the exams)

You're grade is based on your hw and exams, neither of which McCarty writes or lectures on.  Definitely don't take this section if you can avoid it. The course is hard enough, you don't want to have to teach it to yourself.
He threatens to leave the classroom if the students cannot answer the questions he ask. And if you ask a question he answers with "You should know this by now".

A perfect example of how not to teach.  Could care less about his students or how they learn or do.  Just collecting a paycheck.  Teaches subject material the class after the students are tested on it. Wish he'd die and do us all a favor.
