hard class, alot of work, recitations were actually useful.  if you think this is an easy a, turn away.
Have him for recitation, very helpful, explains everything in depth, definitely knows his subject.  Highly recommended, great class!

Lauderdale is a pretty bad teacher...He's definitely a good programmer, and by the way he talks, I think he may be a genius. The problem is that he's terrible at explaining things and spends too much time going over things that we won't need for the exams. It's a good thing I knew Java before starting college or I would've failed CS11 for sure.

I actually do find him funny and it is true that his class is confusing sometimes but he does do a good job of linking topics to make some sense towards the end of class.  He gave us three projects, two of which were ok and one very difficult, but he didn't get on my case for not completing the impossible one (designing an emulator).  I liked him.

Easily the worst professor I've ever had.  His lectures usually had nothing to do with what we should actually be learning, but rather whatever he felt like talking about at the moment.  He assumed the class knew far more than we actually been taught, and talked as if we were complete idiots if we didn't already know the course material.  Avoid!!!!
jumps around topics like a ping pong ball and give a final that is totally off topic
He is a nice guy, went out of his way to help students to with programming assignments, and knew the subject very well.

Easily the worst TA I've ever had.  We didnt learn anything in there, and he would try to teach us Intel assembly when we were learning LC3 in class... telling us it was useless because It hadnt been used in 30 years.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

According to Chris, Rutgers Computer Science is the worst in the nation.  Also, he always says "I Don't know, just make something up".  After you made something up, he'll fail you because he doesn't like you.  Unfortunately, Dr. Levy let this TA grade our exams.  Unfortunately, if you get Chris, you won't have much of a choice.  Good Luck!
I learn more from his recitations than from the lecture. Rick is one of the best TAs in our department and better than some professors.
Awesome

Very Good Teacher. One of the best CS Teachers I have had to date. Very helpful, will do everything he can to help you if you need help, and is very down to earth. He relates well to the students and does his best to explain things as clear as he can make them. Very fun, humorous, and honest.

He is one of the Best upcoming lecturers that RU CS has. He is extremely helpful and keeps the class very interesting. He tries to explain things to the max. As long as you can ask questions, he will keep explaining. Very down to earth guy. Well organized and punctual. His exams are not that easy may be its his first year. A good class to learn.

He is by far one of the best teachers I had in CS. He is very helpful. He will go out of his way to help students. Keeps the class really interesting. Very knowledgeable and will admit stuff that he doesn't know. His Exams are a bit tricky but thats because this was his first time he said. If you want to learn, his class is the place to go..

An excellent teacher, he actually cares that you understand the material and will help you in class and during office hours and make sure that you understand the material. He is not condescending at all and will explain the material until you get it. So if you are serious about learning there is no one better than Chris to teach you.
Tests are just like old ones, get to use a cheat sheet.  I don't get the prior comments either, just had to do the reading and the project was hard.
Tests are exactly like prior exams, just get copies. And read the book.

He is a horrible professor, but I'm sorry I don't know what the people before me are talking about, this class was SO easy.  The 3 hour lecture periods almost never lasted more than ONE HOUR, so 4 credits for being in class 2 hours a week.  The project is a lot of work but doable, and the exams are EASY as pie...look at prior exams they are same!

Double period on Busch from 6:10-9pm, which happened to be right between work and the bars, was a BAD idea. He's so annoying, and the lectures are garbage. I found I had to go to the lectures cause you pick up tidbits here and there, but I fell asleep about 45 minutes in most of the time. And the project is ALOT of work.

Boring, class is like a seminar (slide projector and him talking thats it).  Will not learn a lot in class. A good book is needed to get a good grade, also a good java reference is necessary for projects.  PS(It seams he hates his students)

This guy is what you make of him. He speaks freely (be warned about the profanity). Pretty straightforward, not easy tho, but wont waste your time making you memorize stuff that isnt on the exam. Best Matlab professor at Rutgers. Need help? Always available.
easiest class you will ever take as an engineering student. This guy is the man. Easy A
